sentences.en: Answer restaurant phone within 3 rings, using correct salutations and telephone etiquette.
sentences.cn: 遵照正确的电话礼仪在电话铃响3声之内接起电话.

sentences.en: As in Chinese etiquette, the hostess tries to keep eating as long as the slowest guest.
sentences.cn: 和中国礼节一样, 女主人要一直陪着吃得最慢的客人.

sentences.en: Can you tell me some etiquette about the interview? Of course.
sentences.cn: 你能告诉我一些有关面试礼仪方面的事宜 吗 ?当然可以.

sentences.en: Etiquette was considered very important in Victorian England.
sentences.cn: 英国在维多利亚时代非常注重礼仪.

sentences.en: He was preoccupied with chagrin and etiquette.
sentences.cn: 他耿耿于怀的是经受的是屈辱和应有的仪礼.

sentences.en: In every thing else the etiquette of the day might stand the strictest investigation.
sentences.cn: 那天的仪式,在其他方面都经得起最严格的检验.

sentences.en: In everything the etiquette of the day might stand the strictest investigation.
sentences.cn: 那天的仪式,在各个方面都经得起最严格的检验.

sentences.en: It is against etiquette to do so.
lessons for young ladies in deportment and etiquette
She's a real stickler for etiquette, so you'd better ask her advice.
sentences.cn: 她非常讲求礼节, 所以你最好问她的意见.

sentences.en: The chuntzu would naturally follow the rules and etiquette of Li.
sentences.cn: “君子”会自然地按照礼教的原则和礼仪行事.

sentences.en: This is a book on etiquette.
This was such a great breach of etiquette, he hardly knew what to do.
sentences.cn: 这是严重失礼的行为，他几乎手足无措。

sentences.en: This would be against diplomatic etiquette.
sentences.cn: 这将在外交上犯失礼的错误.

trans.tran_en: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group
